p: Solanum L. ( Solanaceae) is an important plant taxon that comprises many multipurpose flowering plants in several communities and cultures. It has several species known for their medicinal importance [ 3]. Solanum incanum L. is one of the species with multiple traditional applications in many Ethiopian communities. The species is native to and widely distributed in the Horn of Africa. It has thorny leaves, yellow fruits, and blue flowers with yellow pistils [ 4]. It propagates by seeds, and the seeds germinate slowly. S. incanum is common around houses, overgrazed grasslands, wastelands, and road sides [ 5].
